3.name: Judith of Bethulia
3.description: A religious woman seeks to save her people from destruction by seducing and murdering the enemy leader, but her plans get complicated once she falls for him.

4.name: Tillie's Punctured Romance
4.description: A con man from the city dupes a wealthy country girl into marriage.

5.name: The Squaw Man
5.description: A chivalrous British officer takes the blame for his cousin's embezzlement and journeys to the American West to start a new life on a cattle ranch.

6.name: The Patchwork Girl of Oz

10.name: Cinderella
10.description: Though mistreated by her cruel stepmother and stepsisters, Cinderella is able to attend the royal ball through the help of a fairy godmother.

12.name: His Majesty, the Scarecrow of Oz
12.description: A wicked king has taken over the Emerald City, and wants his daughter, Princess Gloria, to marry the horrid courtier Googly-Goo, though she loves Pon, the Gardener's Boy. The camera now ...                See full summary »

13.name: Home, Sweet Home
13.description: John Howard Payne at his most miserable point in life, writes a song which becomes popular and inspires other people at some point in their lives.

14.name: The Life of General Villa
14.description: The life and career of Panccho Villa from young man to revolutionary leader is chronicled.

15.name: The Avenging Conscience: or 'Thou Shalt Not Kill'
15.description: Prevented from dating his sweetheart by his uncle, a young man turns his thoughts to murder.

16.name: The Virginian
16.description: A good-natured but chivalrous cowboy romances the local schoolmarm and leads the posse that brings a gang of rustlers, which includes his best friend, to justice.

17.name: Tess of the Storm Country
17.description: A wealthy resident attempts to dispossess squatters who live near his home, which leads to a false accusation of murder.

18.name: Neptune's Daughter

19.name: A Florida Enchantment
19.description: A young woman discovers a seed that can make women act like men and men act like women. She decides to take one, then slips one to her maid and another to her fiancé. The fun begins.

22.name: Uncle Tom's Cabin
22.description: A black and white silent film based on Harriet Beecher Stowe's novel documenting the life and times of Uncle Tom.

23.name: The Million Dollar Mystery
23.description: This twenty-three episode serial told the story of a secret society called The Black Hundred and its attempts to gain control of a lost million dollars.

24.name: The King of Crime
24.description: A stolen heiress is secretly wed to a man framed for killing her miserly guardian.

28.name: Lola
28.description: With the help of an electric ray machine a scientist brings back to life his daughter killed in a car crash but fails to revive her soul at the same time.

29.name: Sperduti nel buio

30.name: Det hemmelighedsfulde X
30.description: On the brink of war, Lt. van Hauen is summoned to take command of the cruiser, but due to unforeseen events, he is wrongfully convicted as a traitor.

31.name: The Wrath of the Gods
31.description: An American sailor falls in love with a fisherman's daughter and convinces her that Jesus is more powerful than the gods who have cursed her.

32.name: The Exploits of Elaine
32.description: With the help of a private detective, Elaine tries to catch the masked criminal mastermind The Clutching Hand, who has murdered her father.

37.name: Der Hund von Baskerville
37.description: In this early version the classic "Hound of the Baskervilles" mystery is faithfully adapted, although Watson's character is absent. Holmes' foe is called Stapleton and he menaces Holmes' client Lord Henry and his fiancée, Laura Lyons.

40.name: The Spoilers
40.description: The first of many filmed adaptations of Rex Beach's adventure novel of the Alaskan gold-rush.

41.name: The Escape
41.description: A dramatic comparison between the mating habits of animals and the way humans choose their own partners.
